definition: to surrender to the authorities/to turn oneself in (for a crime)
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of

sentences.english: We must stop him from giving himself up.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須阻止他投案自首。

sentences.english: News came that the murderer had given himself up.
sentences.chinese: 有消息說，殺人犯已經投案自首了。

sentences.english: He has been given until noon today to turn himself in to authorities.
sentences.chinese: 他被要求在今天中午前向當局投案自首。

sentences.english: We advised the hijackers to surrender themselves to the police.
sentences.chinese: 我們勸那些劫持者向警察投案。

sentences.english: He gave himself up to the police.
We advised the burglar to surrender himself to the police.
sentences.chinese: 我們規勸竊賊向警方投案自首。

sentences.english: The murderer delivered himself up to justice.
sentences.chinese: 那個兇手向司法部門投案自首。

sentences.english: During the Middle Ages it was believed that witches could turn themselves into black cats.
sentences.chinese: 在中世紀他們相信女巫可以變成黑貓投案自首。

sentences.english: The criminal gave himself up to the police.
sentences.chinese: 罪犯向警察局投案自首。

definition: to give oneself up/to surrender (to the authorities)
to bring to justice/to file away (a document)
to make an appearance in court
to report a case to the authorities
release from custody, subject to provision of a surety, pending investigation (PRC)
to be at large (of a criminal)
to file for investigation/to prosecute (a case)
to dread punishment/afraid of being arrested for a crime
